VERY_SHORT.string: India's Heaviest Satellite CMS-03 Launched for Naval Operations

SHORT.string: ISRO launched CMS-03, India's heaviest communication satellite at 4.4 tons, using the LVM3 rocket from Sriharikota. This satellite, also known as GSAT-7R, will enhance secure, encrypted communication for the Indian Navy, supporting ships, submarines, and coastal stations. It operates in geosynchronous orbit and features multi-band transmission for defense and disaster management. The mission marks India's capability to independently launch heavy satellites, reducing reliance on foreign agencies and boosting its global commercial launch profile.
